1.text: Then answered Eliphaz the Temanite, and said:

2.text: If one venture a word unto thee, wilt thou be weary? But who can withhold himself from speaking?

3.text: Behold, thou hast instructed many, And thou hast strengthened the weak hands.

4.text: Thy words have upholden him that was falling, And thou hast strengthened the feeble knees.

5.text: But now it is come upon thee, and thou art weary; It toucheth thee, and thou art affrighted.

6.text: Is not thy fear of God thy confidence, And thy hope the integrity of thy ways?

7.text: Remember, I pray thee, who ever perished, being innocent? Or where were the upright cut off?

8.text: According as I have seen, they that plow iniquity, And sow mischief, reap the same.

9.text: By the breath of God they perish, And by the blast of His anger are they consumed.

10.text: The lion roareth, and the fierce lion howleth—Yet the teeth of the young lions are broken.

11.text: The old lion perisheth for lack of prey, And the whelps of the lioness are scattered abroad.

12.text: Now a word was secretly brought to me, And mine ear received a whisper thereof.

13.text: In thoughts from the visions of the night, When deep sleep falleth on men,

14.text: Fear came upon me, and trembling, And all my bones were made to shake.

15.text: Then a spirit passed before my face, That made the hair of my flesh to stand up.

16.text: It stood still, but I could not discern the appearance thereof; A form was before mine eyes; I heard a still voice:

17.text: Shall mortal man be just before God? Shall a man be pure before his Maker?

18.text: Behold, He putteth no trust in His servants, And His angels He chargeth with folly;

19.text: How much more them that dwell in houses of clay, Whose foundation is in the dust, who are crushed before the moth!

20.text: Betwixt morning and evening they are shattered; They perish for ever without any regarding it.

21.text: Is not their tent-cord plucked up within them? They die, and that without wisdom.’
